channel.title: Lemmy is listed at Spamhaus with low reputation
channel.description:
Hi @lemmy team,
Just came here to notify some findings. As https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/fediverse-futures-is-now-on-lemmy/1557 I am sharing links around to the community space. At LinkedIn I noticed that the URL is marked as Malicious and LI does not allow access, but redirects to this [LI genneral malware page](https://www.linkedin.com/redir/general-malware-page?url=https%3A%2F%2Flemmy%2eml%2Fc%2Ffediversefutures).
I tested with @bengo on LI a couple of other Lemmy URL's and found only fediverse futures URL to have this. So I contacted LI support:
[details="Response from LinkedIn support (click to expand)"]
![lemmy-linkedin-malicious-website-suspected|690x395](upload://dBTCfEewgxrUKErvtmZEyy3nthp.png)
Hi Arnold,
Thanks for reaching out to us. My name is Natalia from the LinkedIn Member Support Team and I will be happy to help you today.
LinkedIn does not block any external links and does not mark them as "dangerous". Your external URL has been marked as unsafe/spam/malicious by "Spamhaus", which you can check here: https://check.spamhaus.org/listed/?searchterm=lemmy.ml
In order to remove your address from "Spamhaus", I recommend reading detailed information provided in the link above. This link also provides instructions on what steps to take to have your site recognized as safe.
I hope you find the information I have given you useful!
I am wishing you good luck and please contact me again if you have any questions about your account in the future!
Kind Regards,
Natalia Member Support Consultant
---
[/details]
Now, @bengo told me that at his end "All of those were marked as potentially harmful, and I had to click to show the full URL :/ Wonder if it‚Äôs based on the TLD?"
There is indeed one entry for Lemmy: https://check.spamhaus.org/listed/?searchterm=lemmy.ml

Hi @lemmy team,

Just came here to notify some findings. As Fediverse Futures is now on Lemmy üòÉ I am sharing links around to the community space. At LinkedIn I noticed that the URL is marked as Malicious and LI does not allow access, but redirects to this LI genneral malware page.

I tested with @bengo on LI a couple of other Lemmy URL‚Äôs and found only fediverse futures URL to have this. So I contacted LI support:

Response from LinkedIn support (click to expand)

lemmy-linkedin-malicious-website-suspected907√ó520 22 KB

Hi Arnold,

In order to remove your address from ‚ÄúSpamhaus‚Äù, I recommend reading detailed information provided in the link above. This link also provides instructions on what steps to take to have your site recognized as safe.

Member Support Consultant

Now, @bengo told me that at his end ‚ÄúAll of those were marked as potentially harmful, and I had to click to show the full URL Wonder if it‚Äôs based on the TLD?‚Äù
